Sure, here's another version of the LinkedIn post that uses "we" instead of "you":

---

Are we putting too much trust in AI and technology? The "AWESOM-O" episode of South Park offers a comical but cautionary tale about the dangers of assuming technology is more capable than it actually is.

In the episode, Cartman poses as a robot and convinces Hollywood executives to invest in his absurd movie ideas. While the humor is exaggerated, the underlying message is clear: we need to approach technology with a critical eye.

As strategy consultants, it's our responsibility to help clients make informed decisions about the use of technology. While AI and other tools can be incredibly powerful, we need to take a thoughtful and nuanced approach to their implementation. This means evaluating potential benefits and risks, and being willing to adjust course if necessary.

So the next time we're considering a new technology solution, let's take the time to do our due diligence. Let's ask tough questions, evaluate the potential benefits and risks, and be willing to pivot if things don't go as planned. By taking a smart and informed approach, we can help our clients stay ahead of the curve and achieve their goals.

---

This version of the post uses "we" to emphasize the shared responsibility that all strategy consultants have to approach technology with a critical eye. It reinforces the idea that evaluating potential benefits and risks is crucial to making informed decisions about the use of technology, and it positions strategy consultants as trusted advisors who can help clients navigate this process successfully.
